message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE. 

This paper proposes a neural network model for text classification that uses entities in a knowledge base. The model uses a novel neural attention mechanism to focus on relevant entities. This work is related to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning, which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. Specifically, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category as it covers NLP and text classification. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is also likely as it covers techniques for retrieving relevant information from large collections of text. cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category as it covers the development of algorithms that can learn from data. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also possible sub-categories as they cover topics related to machine learning and neural networks.
